intro: Acetosella glutinosa, commonly known as sticky sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a sticky, glandular substance. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its sticky leaves and early flowering make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
